It's important to understand that vaccines are not meant to harm the body, but rather to stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against specific diseases. The body's immune system is naturally designed to recognize and fight off harmful invaders, such as viruses and bacteria. Vaccines are simply a way to trick the immune system into thinking it's under attack so that it will produce antibodies to protect against the disease. The body then stores these antibodies in its memory bank, so that if the body is exposed to the disease again, it can fight it off more quickly and effectively.
